alert.note: Alert for Bath; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:49PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Powell, Montgomery, southwestern Bath and western Menifee Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 948 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Prewitt to Camargo to Oggs Station to near Olympia Springs. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Jeffersonville, Clay Lick, Rothwell and Olympia Springs around 955 PM EDT. Frenchburg, Means, Cedar Groves, Bean and Lucky Stop around 1000 PM EDT. Cornwell and Tabor around 1005 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Fagan and Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 106 and 117. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
